page.title: 02Fakenham Town Sign
page.content: Designed and made by Mr. H. Carter, Swaffham. Brick base built by Fisher and Sons, Fakenham. Stands at east end of Norwich Rd.{Coat of Arms}of Henry 4th. Fakenham was part of the Duchy of Lancaster, 1373 to the 17th century.{ {Printer:}a craft associated with the town.{Ship:}Sir Robert Seppings, born in Fakenham, 1767. Shipwright and naval inventor. Surveyor of the Navy, 1816.{Cycle:}John C Garrood, born in Fakenham 1851. First manufacturer to use tubular cycle forks.{Plough:}Sir George Edwards, founder member of the first agricultural workers' union - Head Office in Hempton. Later he lived in Fakenham. A{Quaker holding a Bible: the Peckover family, merchants and bankers in Fakenham 1655 to 1836. {Ox-wagon:}Rev. Henry Buckenham, born Fakenham, 1844. Methodist missionary to the Orange River & Zambesi.
